security_audit.summary: This is an official skill with documentation and examples only. It includes command patterns that reference external tools and files, but no executable code.

content.user_title: Build reliable Claude Code slash commands
content.value_statement: You need consistent slash commands with clear arguments and safe tool usage. This skill gives proven patterns, frontmatter guidance, and examples for Claude Code.
actual_capabilities: Explains command file structure, locations, and naming conventions
Documents YAML frontmatter fields such as description, allowed-tools, and model
Shows dynamic arguments with $ARGUMENTS and positional parameters
Demonstrates file references using @ syntax for context loading
Provides bash execution patterns and error handling guidance
Covers plugin command organization and CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT usage
limitations: Does not run commands or validate runtime behavior
Examples assume required tools and permissions are available
Does not generate or install commands automatically
Focuses on Claude Code command format, not other platforms

use_cases.title: Ship plugin commands
use_cases.description: Create command files with plugin resources and organized namespaces for a distributed plugin.

use_cases.title: Standardize workflows
use_cases.description: Define shared project commands with frontmatter and argument hints for consistent team use.

use_cases.title: Automate personal tasks
use_cases.description: Build personal slash commands for reviews, documentation, and quick checks.

prompt_templates.title: Create a first command
prompt_templates.scenario: Beginner needs a simple review command
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a simple Claude Code slash command to review a repository. Include a short description and read only tools.

prompt_templates.title: Add arguments
prompt_templates.scenario: Intermediate needs a command with inputs
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a slash command that documents a file path provided by the user. Use argument-hint and @ file reference.

prompt_templates.title: Use bash context
prompt_templates.scenario: Intermediate needs git context in output
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a command that shows current branch and recent commits before analyzing changes. Use allowed-tools with git.

prompt_templates.title: Plugin workflow
prompt_templates.scenario: Advanced needs a multi-step plugin command
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a plugin command that runs build and test scripts from CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT, then summarizes results and next steps.

output_examples.input: Create a slash command that reviews a pull request by number.
output: Command name and file path for the PR review
Frontmatter with description, argument hint, and allowed tools
Prompt body with steps to fetch, review, and report findings
Usage example showing the expected PR number argument

best_practices: Use clear descriptions and argument hints for every command
Limit tool access with allowed-tools to reduce risk
Validate inputs and handle missing files or arguments
anti_patterns: Writing commands as messages to users instead of instructions to Claude
Using Bash(*) for simple tasks that do not need shell access
Hardcoding local paths instead of using CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude Code and Codex?
faq.answer: Yes, it targets Claude Code slash commands and provides patterns usable with Codex prompts.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and examples only. It does not execute commands or verify runtime results.

faq.question: Can it integrate with plugin scripts and templates?
faq.answer: Yes, it documents CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT and shows patterns for scripts, configs, and templates.

faq.question: Does it access or store my data?
faq.answer: No, it is documentation content only and does not collect or transmit data.

faq.question: What if my command does not appear in /help?
faq.answer: Check file location, .md extension, and restart Claude Code. Verify frontmatter syntax.

faq.question: How does this compare to generic prompt guides?
faq.answer: It is specific to Claude Code slash command format, frontmatter fields, and plugin workflows.
